title: May not be effective
comment: Poor sleep may have other factors such as persons environment which cant be influenced by the implant. Therefore it may not be effective in treating sleep disorders on its own and may behave as a short term solution where instead therapy alongside the implant may be more effective.

title: self efficient
comment: It uses natural resources to run (blood flow, vibrations, temperature) which means cost will be negligible when looking at its day to day usage

title: Cost
comment: What will be the cost of using the implant? Will you need to pay to use it? Will you need a certain smartphone which can be expensive for people or will any smart phone work?

title: Ease of burden/usage
comment: Can be used for sleep treatment. It has less burden on participants effort as it will be regulated simply by itself/using the phone app. This is similar to using drugs but removes the negative effects of drugs such as reliance/ addiction to sleep drugs

title: May not be secure
comment: Is the technology safe from hackers? As it uses your phone as well, cyber security may be an issue where some phones may be less secure. Hackers could hack into the implant. what if they change how it works? Can be very dangerous if not properly secure.

title: Easy to use
comment: Easy to use. Simply use a phone app to modify/ access it. And easy to opt out of as it will simply metabolise naturally is a peson does not want to use it anymore

title: Technology usage
comment: Used by implanting a chip and controlling with a phone app

title: Discrimination
comment: People who opt in/ do not opt in may be cast aside/ discriminated against. I.e. people who do use it may feel "better" than those who do not. Can be discriminated in society i.e. Not being hired for a job unless you have the chip

title: Become more controlling?
comment: Sleep wake cycle is not a simple 7-8 hour long cycle. It is usually 90 minute cycles. People could potentially abuse this in the short term where they will opt in for "higher" quality less sleep which can have long term health effects.

title: Better quality of life
comment: A more efficent sleep wake cycle will lead to better health such as not being as tired, less stressed etc. This will lead to a better quality of life for many individuals

title: More productivity
comment: Better sleep wake cycle = efficent sleep for users. This will allow users to be more healthy therefore more productive in many activites such as work/leisure and physical

title: Productivity increase can be abused
comment: More productivity may lead to employees having greater work load as in theory they would be able to complete more work. This can cause physical and mental harm such as stress, counteracting the benefit gained through better sleep.
